basics.name: Donald Stolz
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Enjoys new challenges, actively goes outside comfort zone to pursues experiences of diverse cultures, communities, and ideas. Completes tasks in a highly organized manner, with a strong attention detail. Proven ability to coordinate large group efforts through proficient communication skills.

work.summary: Unstoppable Domains builds blockchain domains, that improve crypto payments by replacing wallet addresses with human readable names and can connect to censorship-resistant decentralized websites.
highlights: Made major mobile UI & performance improvements
Improved site performance by transitioning site from CRA to Next JS
Setup multiple site integrations for business analytics, including technologies such as Segment, Snowflake, & Mode
Lead large projects such as client side business logic refactor

work.summary: Code for fun is a non­profit organization, located in the San Francisco Bay Area, committed to exposing all students to computer science at an early age.
Axlry is an app that helps connect independent artists and record labels to music video directors.
In charge of designing and implementing software solutions to assist with customer resource management and meeting Global Investment Performance Standard.
highlights: Created a custom CRM application using Electron, React JS, and NeDB.

work.summary: Responsible for improving Alumni involvement, developing chapter website, and coordinating online fundraising.
highlights: Member of Board of Advisors, Executive Board, Philanthropy and Recruitment Committees.
Assisted with marketing, coordinating social media fundraising and creating event webpages.
Coordinated and marketed events between alumni and undergraduates.
Published quarterly newsletters and maintained Alumni Website.

work.summary: Responsible for monitoring pool safety and responding to emergency situations.

volunteer.summary: The goal of HackHighSchool is to provide equality of access to computer science and digital literacy for the 21st Century to all high school students age 14-18. HackHighSchool(H2S) is a free,8-month long coding club open from September to May.
highlights: Built app to help manage student check-in and daily reports.

volunteer.summary: The mission of St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital is to advance cures, and means of prevention, for pediatric catastrophic diseases through research and treatment. I coordinated and participated in philanthropic events for St. Jude
Participated in food recovery runs after campus events, recovering food that can be donated to a local food pantry. Assisted with food drives and helped coordinate volunteers from my fraternity.
Played sports with mentally and physically disabled kids, mentoring them and building social skills.

Served as a tutor and teacher’s assistant at Loyola Academy, a Jesuit Middle School for boys who have the potential for college preparatory work, but whose progress may be impeded by economic or social circumstances

highlights: 42 is an innovative engineering and programming college that offers rigorous, industry-leading education in a professional environment.
Sorority and Fraternity Life - New Member of the Year 2016

skills.title: Application Development
description: Built cross-platform mobile and desktop utilizing the react and react-native libraries.

skills.title: Programming Languages
description: Experienced in building applications using JavaScript and web technologies.
Have built personal libraries and projects using C.
Studied object-oriented programming with Java at Loyola.
Built out metrics and simulations for competitions and research projects using R.

skills.title: Leadership
description: Gained leadership experience by achieving my Eagle Scout rank and serving as a member, in multiple positions, of my Fraternity's Executive Board.
Have been responsible for planning online fundraising multiple years and was in charge of our annual Philanthropy as a Senior.

references.name: Nicholas Kimble, TKE-EK President 2014-2016
references.reference: Don strives for academic excellence, he has invested himself so much in an uncharted area of leadership in TKE by becoming the backbone of our design, PR, and website. Don demonstrates commitment to Loyola, the SFL community, and the future through his voluntarily involvement in the clubs and volunteer programs at Loyola.

references.name: Nieky Allen, CTO Elevator Media
references.reference: A creative, intelligent, and quick-on-his-feet engineer, Don proved to be an integral addition to our team. He doesn't shy away from new opportunities to learn by taking initiative.

portfolio.description: A project based intro level curriculum for building APIs with Node JS.

My programs and exercises at 42 Silicon Valley

portfolio.title: Loyola Course Work
portfolio.description: Repositories created for some of the classes I took at Loyola Chicago. Most of the work focuses on Object-Oriented concepts.
